00094     def __init__(
00095         self,
00096         tengine=None,
00097         tilesFileName=None,
00098         sourceTileSize=32,
00099         tileCount=256,
00100         maxSurfaceSize=512,
00101         worldCols=256,
00102         worldRows=256,
00103         renderCol=0,
00104         renderRow=0,
00105         renderCols=256,
00106         renderRows=256,
00107         timeDelay=50,
00108         panX=0,
00109         panY=0,
00110         scale=1.0,
00111         outsideBackgroundColor=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5),
00112         insideBackgroundColor=(0.0, 0.0, 0.0),
00113         scrollWheelZoomScale=1.1,
00114         selectedTool=None,
00115         keyable=True,
00116         pannable=True,
00117         panKeys=(65505, 65506,), # left shift, right shift
00118         zoomable=True,
00119         clickable=True,
00120         pointButton=1, # left button
00121         menuable=True,
00122         menuButton=3, # right button
00123         pie=None,
00124         showCursor=True,
00125         **args):
00126 
00127         gtk.DrawingArea.__init__(self, **args)
00128 
00129         # Compute path to tiles.png file relative to this module
00130         if tilesFileName is None:
00131             path = os.path.join(os.path.basename(__file__),
00132                                 '../images/tileEngine/tiles.png')
00133             tilesFileName = os.path.abspath(path)
00134 
00135         self.tengine = tengine
00136         self.tilesFileName = tilesFileName
00137         self.sourceTileSize = sourceTileSize
00138         self.tileCount = tileCount
00139         self.maxSurfaceSize = maxSurfaceSize
00140         self.worldRows = worldRows
00141         self.worldCols = worldCols
00142         self.renderCol = renderCol
00143         self.renderRow = renderRow
00144         self.renderCols = renderCols
00145         self.renderRows = renderRows
00146         self.timeDelay = timeDelay
00147         self.panX = panX
00148         self.panY = panY
00149         self.scale = scale
00150         self.outsideBackgroundColor = outsideBackgroundColor
00151         self.insideBackgroundColor = insideBackgroundColor
00152         self.scrollWheelZoomScale = scrollWheelZoomScale
00153         self.selectedTool = selectedTool
00154         self.keyable = keyable
00155         self.pannable = pannable
00156         self.panKeys = panKeys
00157         self.zoomable = zoomable
00158         self.clickable = clickable
00159         self.pointButton = pointButton
00160         self.menuable = menuable
00161         self.menuButton = menuButton
00162         self.pie = pie
00163         self.showCursor = showCursor
00164 
00165         self.tilesSourceSurface = None
00166         self.tilesSourceWidth = None
00167         self.tilesSourceHeight = None
00168         self.tileSurface = None
00169         self.tileCtx = None
00170         self.tilesWidth = 0
00171         self.tilesHeight = 0
00172         self.tileFunction = None
00173         self.tileMap = None
00174         self.tileCache = None
00175         self.tileCacheSurfaces = None
00176         self.tileState = None
00177         self.tileCacheCount = 0
00178         self.down = False
00179         self.downX = 0
00180         self.downY = 0
00181         self.tileSize = 16
00182         self.buffer = None
00183         self.bufferWidth = 0
00184         self.bufferHeight = 0
00185         self.windowBuffer = None
00186         self.windowBufferWidth = 0
00187         self.windowBufferHeight = 0
00188         self.cursorX = 0
00189         self.cursorY = 0
00190         self.cursorRow = 0
00191         self.cursorCol = 0
00192         self.mouseX = 0
00193         self.mouseY = 0
00194         self.trackingTool = None
00195         self.trackingToolTrigger = None
00196 
00197         self.tilesLoaded = False
00198 
00199         self.createEngine()
00200 
00201         self.set_flags(
00202             gtk.CAN_FOCUS)
00203 
00204         self.set_events(
00205             gtk.gdk.EXPOSURE_MASK |
00206             gtk.gdk.ENTER_NOTIFY_MASK |
00207             gtk.gdk.LEAVE_NOTIFY_MASK |
00208             gtk.gdk.POINTER_MOTION_MASK |
00209             gtk.gdk.POINTER_MOTION_HINT_MASK |
00210             gtk.gdk.BUTTON_MOTION_MASK |
00211             gtk.gdk.BUTTON_PRESS_MASK |
00212             gtk.gdk.BUTTON_RELEASE_MASK |
00213             gtk.gdk.FOCUS_CHANGE_MASK |

00215             gtk.gdk.KEY_RELEASE_MASK |
00216             gtk.gdk.PROXIMITY_IN_MASK |

00218

00248         self):

00251         if tool:

00261     def getActiveTool(
00262         self):
00263 
00264         return self.trackingTool or self.selectedTool

00267     def changeScale(
00268         self,
00269         scale):
00270 
00271         # Keep the cursor centered on the same place on the screen.
00272 
00273         #print "==== CHANGESCALE", scale
00274 
00275         tileSize = self.tileSize
00276         #print "TILESIZE", tileSize
00277 
00278         panX = self.panX
00279         panY = self.panY
00280         #print "PAN", panX, panY
00281 
00282         # TODO: take into account cursor hot spot, or precise cursor position?
00283 
00284         tool = self.getActiveTool()
00285         if tool:
00286             cursorCol = self.cursorCol
00287             cursorRow = self.cursorRow
00288             cursorCols = tool.cursorCols
00289             cursorRows = tool.cursorRows
00290         else:
00291             # FIXME: This should zoom around the center, I think.
00292             cursorCol = int(math.floor(self.cursorX / tileSize)) # TODO: get rid of cursorX and cursorY and track it in the tool instead.
00293             cursorRow = int(math.floor(self.cursorY / tileSize)) # TODO: get rid of cursorX and cursorY and track it in the tool instead.
00294             cursorRows = 1
00295             cursorCols = 1
00296         #print "CURSOR", cursorCol, cursorRow, cursorCols, cursorRows
00297 
00298         cursorScreenX = panX + (cursorCol * tileSize)
00299         cursorScreenY = panY + (cursorRow * tileSize)
00300         #print "CURSORSCREEN", cursorScreenX, cursorScreenY
00301 
00302         cursorCenterScreenX = cursorScreenX + (0.5 * cursorCols * tileSize)
00303         cursorCenterScreenY = cursorScreenY + (0.5 * cursorRows * tileSize)
00304         #print "CURSORCENTERSCREEN", cursorCenterScreenX, cursorCenterScreenY
00305 
00306         self.setScale(scale)
00307 
00308         tileSize = self.tileSize
00309         #print "TILESIZE", tileSize
00310 
00311         cursorScreenX = cursorCenterScreenX - (0.5 * cursorCols * tileSize)
00312         cursorScreenY = cursorCenterScreenY - (0.5 * cursorRows * tileSize)
00313         #print "CURSORSCREEN", cursorScreenX, cursorScreenY
00314 
00315         panX = cursorScreenX - (cursorCol * tileSize)
00316         panY = cursorScreenY - (cursorRow * tileSize)
00317         #print "PAN", panX, panY
00318 
00319         self.panX = panX
00320         self.panY = panY
00321 
00322 
00323     def setScale(
00324         self,
00325         scale):
00326 
00327         if self.scale == scale:
00328             return
00329 
00330         if not self.window:
00331             return
00332 
00333         self.scale = scale
00334 
00335         ctxWindow = self.window.cairo_create()
00336         self.loadGraphics(ctxWindow, True)
00337 
00338         self.updateView()
00339 
00340 
00341     def loadGraphics(
00342         self,
00343         ctx,
00344         force=False):
00345 
00346         if force or (not self.tilesLoaded):
00347             self.loadTiles(ctx)
00348             self.tilesLoaded = True
00349 
00350 
00351     def loadSurfaceFromPNG(self, fileName):
00352         surface = cairo.ImageSurface.create_from_png(fileName)
00353         return (
00354             surface,
00355             surface.get_width(),
00356             surface.get_height())
00357 
00358 
00359     def loadTiles(
00360         self,
00361         ctx):
00362 
00363         scale = self.scale
00364         sourceTileSize = int(self.sourceTileSize)
00365 
00366         (
00367             tilesSourceSurface,
00368             tilesSourceWidth,
00369             tilesSourceHeight,
00370         ) = self.loadSurfaceFromPNG(self.tilesFileName)
00371 
00372         tilesSourceCols = int(math.floor(tilesSourceWidth / sourceTileSize))
00373         tilesSourceRows = int(math.floor(tilesSourceHeight / sourceTileSize))
00374 
00375         nativeTarget = ctx.get_target()
00376 
00377         if scale == 1.0:
00378 
00379             # We don't need any scaling, so copy directly to a surface of the same size.
00380 
00381             # All tiles are pre-cached.
00382             surfaceIndex = 0
00383             tileCache = array.array('i')
00384             self.tileCache = tileCache
00385             for tile in range(0, self.tileCount):
00386                 col = tile % tilesSourceCols
00387                 row = int(math.floor(tile / tilesSourceCols))
00388                 tileCache.append(1)
00389                 tileCache.append(surfaceIndex)
00390                 tileCache.append(col * sourceTileSize)
00391                 tileCache.append(row * sourceTileSize)
00392 
00393             #print "ALL TILES ARE PRE-CACHED", self.tileCount, len(self.tileCache)
00394 
00395             tileSize = sourceTileSize
00396             tilesWidth = tilesSourceWidth
00397             tilesHeight = tilesSourceHeight
00398 
00399             #print "MAKING TILESSURFACE", tilesWidth, tilesHeight
00400             tilesSurface = nativeTarget.create_similar(cairo.CONTENT_COLOR, tilesWidth, tilesHeight)
00401             #print "DONE"
00402 
00403             tilesCtx = cairo.Context(tilesSurface)
00404             tilesCtx.set_source_surface(tilesSourceSurface, 0, 0)
00405             tilesCtx.set_antialias(cairo.ANTIALIAS_NONE)
00406             tilesCtx.paint()
00407 
00408             self.tileCacheSurfaces = [tilesSurface]
00409             self.tileCacheCount = self.tileCount
00410 
00411             tileSurface = None
00412             tileCtx = None
00413 
00414         else:
00415 
00416             # No tiles are pre-cached.
00417             self.tileCache = array.array('i', (0, 0, 0, 0,) * (self.tileCount))
00418 
00419             #print "NO TILES ARE PRE-CACHED", self.tileCount, len(self.tileCache)
00420 
00421             tileSize = max(1, int(math.floor(0.5 + (scale * sourceTileSize))))
00422 
00423             tilesWidth = tileSize * tilesSourceCols
00424             tilesHeight = tileSize * tilesSourceRows
00425 
00426             #print "tileSize", tileSize, "tilesSourceCols", tilesSourceCols, "tilesSourceRows", tilesSourceRows, "tilesWidth", tilesWidth, "tilesHeight", tilesHeight
00427 
00428             # Clip each tile through this client side 888 surface.
00429             tileSurface = tilesSourceSurface.create_similar(cairo.CONTENT_COLOR, sourceTileSize, sourceTileSize)
00430             tileCtx = cairo.Context(tileSurface)
00431 
00432             tileCtx.set_antialias(cairo.ANTIALIAS_NONE)
00433 
00434             self.tileCacheSurfaces = []
00435             self.tileCacheCount = 0
00436 
00437         self.tilesSourceWidth = tilesSourceWidth
00438         self.tilesSourceHeight = tilesSourceHeight
00439         self.tilesSourceRows = tilesSourceRows
00440         self.tilesSourceCols = tilesSourceCols
00441         self.tilesSourceSurface = tilesSourceSurface
00442         self.tileSize = tileSize
00443         self.tilesWidth = tilesWidth
00444         self.tilesHeight = tilesHeight
00445         self.tileSurface = tileSurface
00446         self.tileCtx = tileCtx
00447 
00448         self.makeTileMap()
00449 
00450         tool = self.getActiveTool()
00451         if tool:
00452             tool.revealCursor(self)
00453 
00454 
00455     def makeTileMap(
00456         self):
00457 
00458         tileMap = array.array('i')
00459         self.tileMap = tileMap
00460         for i in range(0, self.tileCount):
00461             tileMap.append(i)
00462 
00463 
00464     def getTile(
00465         self,
00466         col,
00467         row):
00468 
00469         return 0
00470 
00471 
00472     def createEngine(
00473         self):
00474 
00475         if not self.tengine:
00476 
00477             tengine = tileengine.TileEngine()
00478             self.tengine = tengine
00479 
00480             self.configTileEngine(tengine)
00481 
00482 
00483     def getPie(self):
00484 
00485         pie = self.pie
00486         if pie:
00487             return pie
00488 
00489         self.makePie()
00490 
00491         return self.pie
00492

00494     def makePie(self):
00495 
00496         pass

00498 
00499     def configTileEngine(
00500         self,
00501         tengine):
00502 
00503         tengine.setBuffer(None)
00504         tengine.width = 1
00505         tengine.height = 1
00506         tengine.colBytes = 0
00507         tengine.rowBytes = 0
00508         tengine.typeCode = 'H'
00509         tengine.tileMask = 0xffffffff
00510

00513         self):
00514 
00515         pass

00517 
00518     def handleExpose(
00519         self,
00520         widget,
00521         event,
00522         *args):
00523 
00524         if args:
00525             pass #print "handleExpose TileDrawingArea", self, "WIDGET", widget, "EVENT", event, "ARGS", args
00526 
00527         self.draw(widget, event)
00528 
00529         return False
00530 
00531 
00532     def draw(
00533         self,
00534         widget=None,
00535         event=None):
00536 
00537         self.beforeDraw()
00538 
00539         ctxWindow = self.window.cairo_create()
00540 
00541         winRect = self.get_allocation()
00542         winWidth = winRect.width
00543         winHeight = winRect.height
00544 
00545         self.loadGraphics(ctxWindow)
00546 
00547         windowBuffer = self.windowBuffer
00548         windowBufferWidth = self.windowBufferWidth
00549         windowBufferHeight = self.windowBufferHeight
00550 
00551         slop = 4
00552 
00553         if ((not windowBuffer) or
00554             (windowBufferWidth < winWidth) or
00555             (windowBufferHeight < winHeight)):
00556 
00557             nativeTarget = ctxWindow.get_target()
00558             windowBufferWidth = max(windowBufferWidth, winWidth + slop)
00559             windowBufferHeight = max(windowBufferHeight, winHeight + slop)
00560 
00561             #print "Window Buffer growing from", self.windowBufferWidth, self.windowBufferHeight, "to", windowBufferWidth, windowBufferHeight
00562 
00563             windowBuffer = nativeTarget.create_similar(cairo.CONTENT_COLOR, windowBufferWidth, windowBufferHeight)
00564 
00565             self.windowBuffer = windowBuffer
00566             self.windowBufferWidth = windowBufferWidth
00567             self.windowBufferHeight = windowBufferHeight
00568 
00569         ctxWindowBuffer = cairo.Context(windowBuffer)
00570         ctxWindowBuffer.set_antialias(cairo.ANTIALIAS_NONE)
00571 
00572         panX = self.panX
00573         panY = self.panY
00574         worldCols = self.worldCols
00575         worldRows = self.worldRows
00576         scale = self.scale
00577         tileSize = self.tileSize
00578 
00579         worldWidth = worldCols * tileSize
00580         worldHeight = worldRows * tileSize
00581         worldRight = panX + worldWidth
00582         worldBottom = panY + worldHeight
00583 
00584         #print "WORLDRIGHT", worldRight, "WORLDBOTTOM", worldBottom
00585 
00586         worldLeftClipped = max(0, panX)
00587         worldTopClipped = max(0, panY)
00588         worldRightClipped = min(worldWidth + panX, winWidth)
00589         worldBottomClipped = min(worldHeight + panY, winHeight)
00590 
00591         colLeft = \
00592             int(max(0,
00593                     math.floor(float(0 - panX) /
00594                                float(tileSize))))
00595 
00596         colRight = \
00597             int(min(worldCols,
00598                     math.ceil(float(winWidth - panX) /
00599                               float(tileSize))))
00600 
00601         #print "COLLEFT", colLeft, "COLRIGHT", colRight, "winWidth - panX", winWidth - panX
00602 
00603         rowTop = \
00604             int(max(0,
00605                     math.floor(float(0 - panY) /
00606                                float(tileSize))))
00607 
00608         rowBottom = \
00609             int(min(worldRows,
00610                     math.ceil(float(winHeight - panY) /
00611                               float(tileSize))))
00612 
00613         #print "ROWTOP", rowTop, "ROWBOTTOM", rowBottom, "winHeight - panY", winHeight - panY
00614 
00615         renderCols = colRight - colLeft
00616         renderRows = rowBottom - rowTop
00617 
00618         #print "PANX", panX, "PANY", panY, "TILESIZE", tileSize, "COLS", renderCols, "ROWS", renderRows
00619 
00620         renderX = panX + (colLeft * tileSize)
00621         renderY = panY + (rowTop * tileSize)
00622         renderWidth = renderCols * tileSize
00623         renderHeight = renderRows * tileSize
00624 
00625         self.renderCol = colLeft
00626         self.renderRow = rowTop
00627         self.renderCols = renderCols
00628         self.renderRows = renderRows
00629 
00630         # Make the off-screen buffer to draw the tiles into.
00631 
00632         buffer = self.buffer
00633         bufferWidth = self.bufferWidth
00634         bufferHeight = self.bufferHeight
00635         if ((not buffer) or
00636             (bufferWidth < renderWidth) or
00637             (bufferHeight < renderHeight)):
00638 
00639             nativeTarget = ctxWindow.get_target()
00640             bufferWidth = max(bufferWidth, renderWidth + slop)
00641             bufferHeight = max(bufferHeight, renderHeight + slop)
00642 
00643             #print "Buffer growing from", self.bufferWidth, self.bufferHeight, "to", bufferWidth, bufferHeight
00644 
00645             buffer = nativeTarget.create_similar(cairo.CONTENT_COLOR, bufferWidth, bufferHeight)
00646 
00647             self.buffer = buffer
00648             self.bufferWidth = bufferWidth
00649             self.bufferHeight = bufferHeight
00650 
00651         ctx = cairo.Context(buffer)
00652 
00653         if ((renderCols > 0) and
00654             (renderRows > 0)):
00655 
00656             self.prepareToRenderTiles(ctx)
00657 
00658             #print "renderTilesLazy BEGIN", self.generateTile
00659             self.tengine.renderTilesLazy(
00660                 ctx,
00661                 self.tileFunction,
00662                 self.tileMap,
00663                 self.tileSize,
00664                 self.renderCol,
00665                 self.renderRow,
00666                 renderCols,
00667                 renderRows,
00668                 1.0,
00669                 self.generateTile,
00670                 self.tileCache,
00671                 self.tileCacheSurfaces,
00672                 self.tileState)
00673             #print "renderTilesLazy END"
00674 
00675         ctxWindowBuffer.save()
00676 
00677         ctxWindowBuffer.set_source_surface(
00678             buffer,
00679             renderX,
00680             renderY)
00681 
00682         ctxWindowBuffer.rectangle(
00683             renderX,
00684             renderY,
00685             renderWidth,
00686             renderHeight)
00687 
00688         ctxWindowBuffer.clip()
00689 
00690         ctxWindowBuffer.paint()
00691 
00692         ctxWindowBuffer.restore()
00693 
00694         # Draw the background outside of the tile world.
00695 
00696         backgroundVisible = False
00697 
00698         # Left Background
00699         if panX > 0:
00700             backgroundVisible = True
00701             ctxWindowBuffer.rectangle(
00702                 0,
00703                 worldTopClipped,
00704                 panX,
00705                 worldBottomClipped - worldTopClipped)
00706 
00707         # Right Background
00708         if worldRight < winWidth:
00709             backgroundVisible = True
00710             ctxWindowBuffer.rectangle(
00711                 worldRight,
00712                 worldTopClipped,
00713                 winWidth - worldRight,
00714                 worldBottomClipped - worldTopClipped)
00715 
00716         # Top Background
00717         if panY > 0:
00718             backgroundVisible = True
00719             ctxWindowBuffer.rectangle(
00720                 0,
00721                 0,
00722                 winWidth,
00723                 panY)
00724 
00725         # Bottom Background
00726         if worldBottom < winHeight:
00727             backgroundVisible = True
00728             ctxWindowBuffer.rectangle(
00729                 0,
00730                 worldBottom,
00731                 winWidth,
00732                 winHeight - worldBottom)
00733 
00734         if backgroundVisible:
00735             ctxWindowBuffer.set_source_rgb(*self.outsideBackgroundColor)
00736             ctxWindowBuffer.fill()
00737 
00738         self.drawOverlays(ctxWindowBuffer)
00739 
00740         ctxWindow.set_source_surface(
00741             windowBuffer,
00742             0,
00743             0)
00744 
00745         ctxWindow.paint()
00746 
00747 
00748     def beforeDraw(
00749         self):
00750 
00751         pass
00752 
00753 
00754     def prepareToRenderTiles(
00755         self,
00756         ctx):
00757         pass
00758 
00759 
00760     # This function is called from the C++ code in self.tengine.renderTilesLazy.
00761     # It renders a tile, and returns a tuple with a surface index, tile x and tile y position.
00762     # This function is totally in charge of the scaled tile cache, and can implement a variety
00763     # of different policies.
00764     def generateTile(
00765         self,
00766         tile):
00767 
00768         #print "======== GENERATETILE", tile
00769 
00770         # Get the various tile measurements.
00771         sourceTileSize = self.sourceTileSize
00772         tilesSourceSurface = self.tilesSourceSurface
00773         tilesSourceCols = self.tilesSourceCols
00774         tileSize = self.tileSize
00775         tileCtx = self.tileCtx
00776         tileSurface = self.tileSurface
00777         tileCacheSurfaces = self.tileCacheSurfaces
00778         scale = self.scale
00779         maxSurfaceSize = self.maxSurfaceSize
00780 
00781         # Calculate the measurements per surface, each of which contains one or more tiles,
00782         # depending on the tile size.
00783         # If the tiles are small, we will put a lot of them per surface, but as they get
00784         # bigger, we limit the size of the surface by reducing the number of tiles, so the
00785         # surfaces to not get too big.
00786 
00787         tileColsPerSurface = max(1, int(math.floor(maxSurfaceSize / tileSize)))
00788         #print "tileColsPerSurface", tileColsPerSurface
00789 
00790         tilesPerSurface = tileColsPerSurface * tileColsPerSurface
00791         #print "tilesPerSurface", tilesPerSurface
00792 
00793         surfaceSize = tileColsPerSurface * tileSize
00794         #print "surfaceSize", surfaceSize
00795 
00796         cacheTile = self.tileCacheCount
00797         self.tileCacheCount += 1
00798 
00799         surfaceIndex = int(math.floor(cacheTile / tilesPerSurface))
00800         #print "surfaceIndex", surfaceIndex
00801 
00802         ctxWindow = None
00803         nativeTarget = None
00804         while len(tileCacheSurfaces) <= surfaceIndex:
00805             #print "MAKING TILESSURFACE", len(tileCacheSurfaces), tilesPerSurface, surfaceSize
00806             if nativeTarget == None:
00807                 ctxWindow = self.window.cairo_create()
00808                 nativeTarget = ctxWindow.get_target()
00809             tilesSurface = nativeTarget.create_similar(cairo.CONTENT_COLOR, surfaceSize, surfaceSize)
00810             tileCacheSurfaces.append(tilesSurface)
00811             #print "DONE"
00812 
00813         tilesSurface = tileCacheSurfaces[surfaceIndex]
00814         tileOnSurface = cacheTile % tilesPerSurface
00815         #print "tileOnSurface", tileOnSurface
00816         tileCol = tileOnSurface % tileColsPerSurface
00817         tileRow = int(math.floor(tileOnSurface / tileColsPerSurface))
00818         #print "tileCol", tileCol, "tileRow", tileRow
00819         tileX = tileCol * tileSize
00820         tileY = tileRow * tileSize
00821         #print "tileX", tileX, "tileY", tileY
00822         sourceTileCol = tile % tilesSourceCols
00823         sourceTileRow = int(math.floor(tile / self.tilesSourceCols))
00824         #print "sourceTileCol", sourceTileCol, "sourceTileRow", sourceTileRow
00825 
00826         # Make a temporary tile the size of a source tile.
00827         tileCtx.set_source_surface(
00828             tilesSourceSurface,
00829             -sourceTileCol * sourceTileSize,
00830             -sourceTileRow * sourceTileSize)
00831         tileCtx.paint()
00832 
00833         tilesCtx = cairo.Context(tilesSurface)
00834         tilesCtx.set_source_surface(tilesSourceSurface, 0, 0)
00835 
00836         # Scale it down into the tilesSurface.
00837         tilesCtx.save()
00838 
00839         x = tileCol * tileSize
00840         y = tileRow * tileSize
00841 
00842         tilesCtx.rectangle(
00843             x,
00844             y,
00845             tileSize,
00846             tileSize)
00847         tilesCtx.clip()
00848 
00849         # Try to keep the tiles centered.
00850         fudge = 0 # (0.5 * (scale - tileSize))
00851 
00852         x += fudge
00853         y += fudge
00854 
00855         tilesCtx.translate(
00856             x,
00857             y)
00858 
00859         #print "X", x, "Y", y, "FUDGE", fudge, "SCALE", scale, "TILESIZE", tileSize
00860 
00861         # Make it a pixel bigger to eliminate the fuzzy black edges.
00862         #zoomScale = float(tileSize) / float(sourceTileSize)
00863         zoomScale = float(tileSize) / float(sourceTileSize - 1.0)
00864 
00865         #print "ZOOMSCALE", zoomScale, "TILESIZE", tileSize, "SOURCETILESIZE", sourceTileSize
00866 
00867         tilesCtx.scale(
00868             zoomScale,
00869             zoomScale)
00870 
00871         #smear = True
00872         smear = False
00873 
00874         if smear:
00875 
00876             fudge = 0.5
00877             for dx, dy in (
00878                 (-fudge, -fudge),
00879                 ( fudge, -fudge),
00880                 (-fudge,  fudge),
00881                 ( fudge,  fudge),
00882                 (-fudge,  0.0),
00883                 ( fudge,  0.0),
00884                 ( 0.0, -fudge),
00885                 ( 0.0,  fudge),
00886                 ( 0.0,  0.0),
00887             ):
00888                 tilesCtx.save()
00889 
00890                 tilesCtx.translate(dx, dy)
00891 
00892                 tilesCtx.set_source_surface(
00893                     tileSurface,
00894                     0,
00895                     0)
00896                 tilesCtx.paint()
00897 
00898                 tilesCtx.restore()
00899 
00900         else:
00901 
00902             tilesCtx.set_source_surface(
00903                 tileSurface,
00904                 -0.5,
00905                 -0.5)
00906             tilesCtx.paint()
00907 
00908         tilesCtx.restore()
00909 
00910         #print "GENERATETILE", tile, "surfaceIndex", surfaceIndex, "tileX", tileX, "tileY", tileY
00911 
00912         result = (surfaceIndex, tileX, tileY)
00913         #print "GENERATETILE", tile, "RESULT", result
00914         return result
00915

00917     def drawOverlays(
00918         self,
00919         ctx):
00920 
00921         if self.showCursor:
00922             tool = self.getActiveTool()
00923             if tool:
00924                 tool.drawCursor(self, ctx)

00927     def cursorMoved(self):
00928         self.updateView()

00931     def moveCursorToMouse(
00932         self,
00933         x,
00934         y):
00935 
00936         tool = self.getActiveTool()
00937         if tool:
00938             tool.setCursorPos(
00939                 self,
00940                 x - self.panX,
00941                 y - self.panY)

00944     def getEventXY(
00945         self,
00946         event):
00947         if (hasattr(event, 'is_hint') and
00948             event.is_hint):
00949             x, y, state = event.window.get_pointer()
00950         else:
00951             x = event.x
00952             y = event.y
00953 
00954         tileSize = self.tileSize
00955 
00956         return (
00957             (x - self.panX) / tileSize,
00958             (y - self.panY) / tileSize,
00959         )
00960 
00961 
00962     def getEventColRow(
00963         self,
00964         event):
00965         if (hasattr(event, 'is_hint') and
00966             event.is_hint):
00967             x, y, state = event.window.get_pointer()
00968         else:
00969             x = event.x
00970             y = event.y
00971 
00972         tileSize = self.tileSize
00973         col = int((x - self.panX) / tileSize)
00974         row = int((y - self.panY) / tileSize)
00975 
00976         return (col, row)

00979     def updateView(self):
00980         self.queue_draw()
00981         self.parent.queue_draw() # @bug Why is this necessary? Doesn't draw without it. Are we really a window?
00982

00984     def panTo(self, x, y):
00985         self.panX = x
00986         self.panY = y
00987         self.updateView()
00988 
00989 
00990     def panBy(self, dx, dy):
00991         self.panTo(
00992             self.panX + dx,
00993             self.panY + dy)

00995 
00996     def centerOnTile(self, tileX, tileY):
00997         tileSize = self.tileSize
00998 
00999         px = -tileSize * tileX
01000         py = -tileSize * tileY
01001 
01002         rect = self.get_allocation()
01003         winWidth = rect.width
01004         winHeight = rect.height
01005 
01006         px += winWidth / 2
01007         py += winHeight / 2
01008 
01009         #print "centerOnTile", "tile", tileX, tileY, "tileSize", self.tileSize, "scale", self.scale, "p", px, py
01010 
01011         self.panTo(px, py)
01012 
01013 
01014     def getCenterTile(self):
01015         tileSize = self.tileSize
01016 
01017         rect = self.get_allocation()
01018         winWidth = rect.width
01019         winHeight = rect.height
01020 
01021         tileX = ((winWidth / 2) - self.panX)  / tileSize
01022         tileY = ((winHeight / 2) - self.panY) / tileSize
01023 
01024         #print "getCenterTile", "tile", tileX, tileY, "tileSize", self.tileSize, "scale", self.scale
01025      
01026         return tileX, tileY

01029     def selectToolByName(self, toolName):
01030         print "selectToolByName", toolName
01031 
01032         tool = tiletool.TileTool.getToolByName(toolName)
01033 
01034         lastTool = self.selectedTool
01035         if lastTool:
01036             tool.deselect(self)
01037 
01038         if tool:
01039             tool.select(self)
01040 
01041         self.selectedTool = tool

01078     def handleKeyPress(
01079         self,
01080         widget,
01081         event):
01082 
01083         if not self.keyable:
01084             return
01085 
01086         key = event.keyval
01087 
01088         #print "KEYPRESS", key
01089 
01090         if (self.pannable and
01091             (not self.trackingTool) and
01092             (key in self.panKeys)):
01093             panTool = tiletool.TileTool.getToolByName('Pan')
01094             #print "panTool", panTool
01095             if panTool:
01096                 self.trackingToolTrigger = key
01097                 self.trackingTool = panTool
01098                 panTool.startPanning(self)
01099                 #print "Activated panTool", panTool
01100                 return
01101 
01102         if self.handleKey(key):
01103             return
01104 
01105         tool = self.getActiveTool()
01106         if tool:
01107             if tool.handleKeyDown(self, event):
01108                 return
01109 
01110         # TODO: This might be handled by the pan tool.
01111         if self.zoomable:
01112             if key == ord('i'):
01113                 self.changeScale(self.scale * 1.1)
01114             elif key == ord('I'):
01115                 self.changeScale(self.scale * 2.0)
01116             elif key == ord('o'):
01117                 self.changeScale(self.scale * 0.9)
01118             elif key == ord('O'):
01119                 self.changeScale(self.scale * 0.5)
01120             elif key == ord('r'):
01121                 self.changeScale(1.0)
01122

01126         key):
01127 
01128         pass
01129

01132         self,
01133         widget,
01134         event):
01135 
01136         if not self.keyable:

01138 
01139         #print "KEYRELEASE", event.keyval
01140 
01141         tool = self.getActiveTool()
01142         if tool:
01143             if tool.handleKeyUp(self, event):
01144                 return
01145 
01146         key = event.keyval

01158 
01159     def updateCursorPosition(
01160         self,
01161         event):
01162 
01163         if not event:
01164             x, y, state = self.window.get_pointer()
01165         elif (hasattr(event, 'is_hint') and
01166               event.is_hint):
01167             x, y, state = event.window.get_pointer()
01168         else:
01169             x = event.x
01170             y = event.y
01171             state = event.state
01172 
01173         self.mouseX = x
01174         self.mouseY = y
01175 
01176         self.moveCursorToMouse(x, y)
01177 
01178         if self.down:
01179             self.handleMouseDrag(event)
01180         else:
01181             self.handleMouseHover(event)
01182 
01183 
01184     def handleMouseDrag(
01185         self,
01186         event):
01187 
01188         if not self.clickable:
01189             return
01190 
01191         tool = self.getActiveTool()
01192         if tool:
01193             tool.handleMouseDrag(self, event)
01194

01209     def handlePieButtonPress(
01210         self,
01211         widget,
01212         event):
01213 
01214         print "handleButtonPress TileDrawingArea", self
01215 
01216         #print "EVENT", event
01217         #print dir(event)
01218 
01219         if (self.clickable and
01220             (event.button == self.pointButton)):
01221 
01222             self.down = True
01223             self.downX = event.x
01224             self.downY = event.y
01225 
01226             tool = self.getActiveTool()
01227             #print "Active tool:", tool
01228             if tool:
01229                 tool.handleMouseDown(self, event)
01230 
01231         elif (self.menuable and
01232               (event.button == self.menuButton)):
01233 
01234             pie = self.getPie()
01235 
01236             if pie:
01237 
01238                 win_x, win_y, state = event.window.get_pointer()
01239 
01240                 #print "POP UP PIE", pie, win_x, win_y, state
01241                 #print "WIN", win_x, win_y
01242 
01243                 x, y = event.get_root_coords()
01244 
01245                 #print "ROOT", x, y
01246 
01247                 pie.popUp(x, y, False)
01248

01268     def handleButtonRelease(
01269         self,
01270         widget,
01271         event):
01272 
01273         #print "handleButtonRelease TileDrawingArea", self
01274 
01275         if not self.clickable:
01276             return
01277 
01278         self.handleMouseDrag(event)
01279 
01280         self.down = False
01281 
01282         tool = self.getActiveTool()
01283         if tool:
01284             tool.handleMouseUp(self, event)

01286 
01287     def handleMouseScroll(
01288         self,
01289         widget,
01290         event):
01291 
01292         if not self.zoomable:
01293             return
01294 
01295         direction = event.direction
01296 
01297         if direction == gtk.gdk.SCROLL_UP:
01298             self.changeScale(self.scale * self.scrollWheelZoomScale)
01299         elif direction == gtk.gdk.SCROLL_DOWN:
01300             self.changeScale(self.scale / self.scrollWheelZoomScale)
